text: Glam rock is a genre of rock music that was popular in the early 1970s. It was made famous by acts such as David Bowie, Elton John, T. Rex, Alice Cooper, Slade, Gary Glitter, Queen and Sweet. The music was characterised by languid, narcotic ballads and raunchy, high-energy Rolling Stones–influenced rock n‘ roll stylings. Glam fans (usually referred to as the "glitter people") and performers distinguished themselves with sci-fi/mythological/Hollywood glamour/ambisexual-inspired costumes, which were perceived as glamorous by the press. They wore platform shoes to symbolize their decadence. ==Notable artists== *T. Rex *David Bowie *Gary Glitter *Roxy Music *Mott the Hoople *Alice Cooper *Queen *Mud *Wizzard *Suzi Quarto *Slade *Sweet *Rolling Stones (were influenced on their 1973 song Silver Train).
